job_title: Assistant Professor of Finance in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Nice benefit; Great coworkers; Wonder working culture.
cons: I do not think there are any cons.

job_title: OIT Student Worker in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: OIT itself is run very well, everyone there is incredibly nice and passionate, and they make for a great workspace.
cons: Expect to hear about only bad things that come from departments that have control over OIT. Pay is very low for the work and skills you will be using. Few opportunities for advancement beyond basic title changes / pay increase

job_title: Career Coach in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: flexible remote work options since COVID.
cons: very little room or growth for upward movement.

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: The job is convenient if you are currently enrolled in classes at the school.
cons: The pay is not the best.

review_title: Great position to save money while gaining leadership experience.
job_title: Resident Assistant (RA) in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Housing and food on campus are paid for by this position.
cons: You live where you work.

job_title: Research Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Good work invironment to be in.
cons: Limited hours available depending on position.

job_title: Intern in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Nice Working environment Food was avaiblible
cons: You have to pay for your own parking because it is a Univerisity

job_title: Senior Instructor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Treat instructors well with benied
cons: Tenured staff get arrogant and have no idea how little instructors make

job_title: Assistant Professor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Depending on the department, there are wonderful colleagues
cons: The pay for Tenure Track faculty is very low compared to other R2 schools. Even though the output expectations are as high as any other school, the pay has not increased in line with the cost of living. The pay rate for professors is lower than admin jobs

job_title: Orientation Leader in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Fantastic working environment with extremely supportive management.
cons: There are no cons that I can think of. This is a wonderful place to work.

job_title: IT Help Desk Technician in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Supervisors are great and one of the only reasons I stay at this job in this position
cons: This is a student position. Pay is $12.95 starting, $14.25 after a year, and $15.68 if you are able to become a senior technician, but the amount of required knowledge and skills means that even technicians are way underpaid. Lots of staff and tenured professors seem to think we should just be able to fix anything that they request, even if it doesn't have anything to do with the job.

job_title: Admissions Office in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Most of my coworkers were nice, somewhat flexible schedules if you are a student.
cons:
UCCS is a growing university where thousands of people apply to attend each year, yet the admissions office is run like a small community college. Only a few people process hundreds of transcripts a day. People's transcripts go missing all the time due to overworked and underpaid staff. 

Lots of cheesy sales tactics are used to try and get high schoolers to apply to UCCS. Yes, UCCS does have a high acceptance rate but also a high drop-out rater. This gives our university a bad reputation on par with a community college. 

Student-workers in the admissions office are overworked and are discouraged from taking time off, even if they test positive for COVID.

job_title: Research Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: You get paid once a month and during summer you can get a pay raise of up to $2000 per month on research grant since you work 40hrs in summer and 20hrs during fall and spring
cons: Time management can be steep.

job_title: Lecturer in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Colleagues, setting, engaged and motivated student body.
cons: Nothing, in particular, comes to mind.

job_title: Program Specialist in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Really good benefits, sick time and pto start accruing the day you start work which is great!
cons: Toxic culture, very little possibility for salary increases

job_title: Bookstore Assistant, Sales Associate in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Flexible
Work around schedule
Coworkers and customers are your peers
cons:
Busy
Can’t do homework when it’s slow

job_title: Academic Services Professional in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: It’s in higher Ed so contributing to that mission is fulfilling
cons: There is a lack of accountability, especially in higher administrative positions

job_title: Research Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Decent pay
Flexible schedule
Interesting work 
Rewarding
cons: Pay could always be better

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Good and accommodating faculty. Flexible scheduling for Teaching assistants.
cons: Timetable for positions in the following semester seem to fast.

review_title: Good but Salary less than other University
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Good working environment. Have some advantages for Masters's degree holder.
cons: Low salary than other universities. House rent is creeping higher in this city. No health insurance coverage by University.

job_title: Student Ambassador in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: On campus, flexible hours, great managment
cons: needs better pay and opprotunities for bonuses

job_title: Academic Advisor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great community of people working there
cons: Pay is low and should earn more

job_title: Associate Director in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Good benefits 401k was awesome.
cons: Too many to list. Slow to make change, high and mighty attitude of Vice Chancellors and little respect for front line workers. Good ole boy system is/was rampant. It was CU Boulder south, they hired who they knew at Boulder. Feedback is ignored. Way under paid for the amount of responsibilities and work given. Previous mistakes from years ago being brought up in current performance reviews. Management styles are antiquated and autocratic.

job_title: Veteran Service Representative in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great atmosphere on campus and convenient to work there when going to school full time. Flexible on your schedule, and works around class times.
cons: The Department Staff lacked at the Veteran Center lacked respect for the work study employees, which were all veterans and doing the brunt of the work for the office. There has been changes since worked there but at the time work study employees were looked down on and insulted. The Outreach Coordinator in the office frequently expressed annoyance with helping veteran students and would pass them off to work study employees.

job_title: Work Study Student in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Get to do your homework as they pay you
cons: Hourly wage is significantly less than those outside of work-study at UCCS.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Good for students who want to work before, after or in between classes.
cons: Compensation is typically on the lower end. Hours are limited to 25 if full time.

job_title: Executive Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Pay and benefits were nice. Some opportunity for learning new things and networking.
cons: The department I worked in had one person who was toxic. It was known that this person was toxic, but nothing ever got done to fix it. The person had too much power in the department. This person was the single biggest reason I left, because they made the job miserable. My supervisor failed to do what they needed to do. My department was not the only one with this problem. The organization culture is inconsistent, there's a ton of favoritism, and only token investment in employee development.

job_title: Print Technician in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Hours were flexible, and the job was fun and related to my studies. Plus I could work on other school work when there was no one to help.
cons: I was working in a spooky room in the basement all alone at times, and although I was able to call my boss I was not directly supervised so if I ran into problems I was kind of stuck.

review_title: A nice and quiet place to do research
job_title: Assistant Professor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Nice colleagues 
Quiet small town means less distractions, so I can focus closely on research
cons:
Lack of career development opportunities 
Weaker financial supports to social science researchers

review_title: Few hours, little pay, fun work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Denver, CO
pros: The work is fun and it's a great way to network with other students.
cons: Terrible pay and you don't get many hours.

job_title: Orientation Leader in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great university, awesome staff, really enjoyed it
cons: Not anything I can think of

job_title: Instructor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: They are pretty flexible with teaching curriculum.
cons: The is so terrible no matter what my experience contains.

review_title: Pretty chill and helps me learn about IT applications
job_title: Information Technology Student Worker in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: It's a good student environment. Flexible hours for classes and they help with teaching on the job.
cons: There were a few times where I did not have a task to work on so I was lost on what to do.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO

good boos
good experience with students and coworkers

review_title: Why make me fill this out?
job_title: Graduate Student Researcher in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great place, I like it.
cons: This is dumb and annoying.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: We have great faculty, staff, and students. The university is growing and expanding into new areas. Colorado Springs is a wonderful place to live, and UCCS is a great workplace. The campus serves a diverse student body with lots of veterans, 1st generation college students, and non-traditional working students. The campus has a great culture that supports equity, diversity, and inclusion while also providing a balanced lifestyle. As an R2 university, UCCS values excellence in research, teaching, and service.
cons: The campus receives minimal state funding, which is a shame because the UCCS campus doesn't have the same large financial endowment as the campus at CU-Boulder.

job_title: Office Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Environment and your fellow colleagues.
cons: Pay is a little low.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: A good place to work
cons:
Very high workload in there
Less dev opportunity in there
Less research oriented in there

job_title: Artist in Colorado Springs, CO

cons: Horrible payment process, it all comes through the website

job_title: Math Tutor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great place to work to improve upon already known math skills.
cons: None that I can think of.

pros: Good work life balance, supportive supervisor, flexible schedule and autonomy

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO

cons: Less pay for the amount of work expected.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: It is such a great place

review_title: The Excel Communication center is the best job I have ever had
job_title: Peer Tutor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Opportunity to help others grow
Amazing boss
Great coworkers
cons: I cannot think of any cons.

job_title: Student Assistant Lead in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Flexible scheduling, Meals benefit, Training in multiple positions
cons: No consistent top-down communication, Inconsistent positive and negative cultures

job_title: Production Specialist in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: great developent with all employees
cons: it was frustrating when we were scheduled

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: The Kraemer Family is honestly my favorite place to be at. I love working there!!
cons: I haven't found any cons yet.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Being surrounded by great people is the best part.
cons: Your salary cannot grow as much as in a commercial or private company.

review_title: Great place to work, but a few tweaks needed
job_title: Administrative Assistant III in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great people, Emphasis on diversity and inclusion, excellent benefits package
cons:
Employees pay for parking on campus, organization is very top-heavy.
Pay is not great.  A Classified Staff member with some experience and no degree can make as much as a University Staff employee who does have a degree.

job_title: Cook II in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: The food is easy the benefits are pretty good and most of the students are fun to work with
cons: You pay $600+ dollars a year to park on campus and the price raises each year. Huge lack of communication in departments. Bosses have very little accountability unless there are complaints about the food. If someone sexually harasses you and there chummy with the Main Executive Chef (there is an executive of residential dining too but she works hard) he will sweep the problem under the rug and "encourage" you to leave.

job_title: English Instructor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Some of the best people I ever had the privilege to work with - both peers and superiors: compassionate, supportive, friendly, knowledgeable, and passionate about the work.
cons: My full-time instructor salary was well below the cost of living for the area with minimal opportunity for future growth - in terms of both compensation and career advancement.

job_title: Director in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Working with students is great. Seeing them arrive on campus and than graduate with knowledge is exciting.Working with faculty can be so rewarding but at times challenging  also. .
cons: Higher Education is in a mode of fear and compliance. There is a paradigm shift coming to Higher Ed and no one is sure what he future looks like.

review_title: Being a professor can be a great job and UCCS offers a very positive work environment and culture.
job_title: Professor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Very positive organizational culture with lots of supportive, friendly, and bright people to work with.  Great location if you like the mountains and a sunny climate.  The university also provides lots of flexibility to do what you want to do in your research and teaching.  Overall, it is a very encouraging, open, and positive place for tenure track faculty.
cons: Salaries are a bit below market and like many universities it is somewhat slow to change and do new things

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: UCCS is a fast growing university that strives to serve it's campus and community constituents with excellence and dedication.  I was impressed by the use of cutting edge technology and innovation for diverse classroom delivery methods.  The administration is very approachable and I appreciated the culture of openness to constantly improve and work hard to meet the needs of the diverse student population.  I truly enjoyed working there!
cons: I wish the training was stronger but I really enjoyed working with my coworkers and I was able to get to know staff from other departments very quickly.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: I have graduate assistantship in the Ultrasound project under Dr. Nanna Meyer. It's very interesting job, I get to learn a lot, learned a new technique i.e. Ultrasound machine , get to work from home and the pay scale is good too.
cons: The only downside I see is internationals are allowed to work only 20 hours/ week which limits it and less scholarships for internationals.

review_title: As a UCCS student, this job was great!
job_title: General Staff in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: I work as a general staff in the "Roaring Forks" at UCCS. Working there has helped me develop a great deal of discipline. The faculty over there  wonderful, they understand that students have messy schedules sometimes and they try to accommodate with it. Make sure you put in the effort and you won't get disappointed.
cons: As a general staff, you have no idea what you're going to be working on beforehand. As you get to the shift, the student manager will have assigned a station for you to work at.

job_title: Layout Editor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Excellent atmosphere, office is a great place to meet new people and build lasting relationships. Having the opportunity to create something new every week is also a big boost for any young professional.
cons: Having commissioned student employees can sometimes mean they are not as committed as the full/part time time student employees. Which can get frustrating, but is a fact of life.

review_title: UCCS is a great place to learn and to work.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: The campus offers a nice work environment with smart co-workers, a good positive vibe, 9 credit per year tuition benefit, and a good small-campus feel. The university is in a growth phase with lots of new construction. It is exciting to witness the school's transformation from a commuter school to a traditional university with dorms and lots of campus activities.
cons: Parking is a problem, limited career opportunities for non PhDs, many salaries are below market but the benefits help make up for some of the difference.

review_title: Excellent education by people who care about whether you learn, not just if you get good grades.
job_title: Teaching Assistant/Grader in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Involved professors who always have time for students, expanding facilities to meet growing student population, still small enough to feel like you aren't lost in the system.
cons: Limited parking - number one complaint from faculty, staff and students doesn't seem to be much of a priority while students/ classroom capacity is expanding.

job_title: Alternate Media Production Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: This is the perfect job for someone with an eye for detail and who loves helping others succeed. Schedules are very flexible, except at the beginning of the semester when students need books the most. Clean and quiet environment and awesome coworkers.
cons: Not necessarily a con, but this position does work closely with people with disabilities. Some people are uneasy about being around those with disabilities and it may take some time for you to get comfortable approaching the unique challenges associated with our student population.

job_title: Professor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great students, beautiful campus, great peers to work with.
cons: Hypocritical leadership claims to be collaborating with faculty but has lost track of the core mission of the university and often treats faculty essentially as adversaries.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
I work in I.T department. Pros are:
The work is easy
It pays slightly above minimum wage
cons:
Other employees that do the same thing make triple the amount
Employees are not trained
Yes the work is easy but that also means there are never any challenges
Did I mention that they don't train you? Or teach you anything?
It's really amazing the amount of people who have masters degrees who know absolutely nothing (I mean nothing, seriously) about computers.

review_title: A great place to work, and a great place to attend - but just don't get branded as a student.
job_title: Helpdesk Technician in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: The culture at UCCS, for the most part, was very good for a "commuter school." Everyone was friendly, and you knew everyone in your department. Overall A.
cons: At times it seemed like the University aspect of working could get to the employees. The climate had some shifts when there were no students around, and hints of disapproval of students could be seen.

job_title: Costume Shop Manager in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: UCCS offers a great benefits package.I have a flexible schedule. Theater is project oriented, so its a fantastic sense of completion. Ability to both shop manage and costume design.
cons: Long hours during tech, no overtime. We run a small crew, so at times the work load can be overwhelming.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant
pros:
- Many avenues of research you can pursue and opportunities to help others with their research
- Great professors and mentors to guide you through your professional development
- Great staff to be around.
- Very flexible schedule
- Opportunities to interact with scientists and engineers from other universities, companies, and government labs
- Opportunities to present work in professional conferences
cons: Very few downsides to being a research assistant at UCCS, compared with the same position at other universities.

review_title: Love the campus and students, not a fan of the politics and cliques.
job_title: Academic Services Director in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great atmosphere, lot of room for growth, beautiful campus, professional developmental opportunities are encouraged, very stable and consistent environment, most faculty and staff are generally very friendly.
cons: Who you know is sometimes more important that what you know. Cliques are common among certain departments and campus leaders, often times leading to the advancement of less qualified employees and favoritism.

review_title: A fine university, uderestimated and underfunded
job_title: in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Collegial atmosphere
Teaching students who work hard to pay for college and not typically subsidized by daddy
Beautiful campus
Exciting to work there during a time of growth
Excellent chancellor and business dean who engage the community and come down out of the ivory tower.
Entrepreneurial campus
cons:
Underfunded, so pay is low.
Parking is almost always a challenge.
Nepotism in staff hires, new people and ideas are not always welcome

job_title: Lab Manager in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Friendly people, good benefits, beautiful campus, and easy work hours. Super relaxed, I'd say we are way less efficient than a standard work place, I'm convinced several employees do nothing but walk around and chat with others.
cons: Very hard to spend money, even if it saves money. Expensive parking and is frequently hard to find a spot. Low pay unless you spend your whole life here.

review_title: Positive work environment, if you show drive and interest you will be rewarded with growth opportunities.
job_title: Rec Center Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
-Worked around school schedule 
-Consistent schedule weekly schedule 
-Positive environment
-Co-Worker relationships
-Room for growth if you show interest
cons:
-It was hard getting other students to cover your shifts
-Upper management had tension 
-Overlooked employees during busy times 
-Low wages and minimal hours

review_title: Great place to work while in School.
job_title: Faculty in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Very flexible with school schedule.
Employees are very nice.
Pay is average to above average for part time.
cons:
Employers unorganized about what needs to get done sometimes.
Don't expect to keep your job after you graduate.
If you are not a manger or work for administration do not expect to be heard if you have ideas for change.

review_title: My time as a student employee at UCCS was a great learning experience.
job_title: Helpdesk Technician in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: As a student employee, I had a great time working with students and faculty members. The diverse experience in the IT department was a great launchpad for greater IT jobs.
cons: Difficult customers sometimes made it hard to work well, but still providing excellent troubleshooting and customer service experiences.

job_title: in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
- A lot of great people to work with
- Supervisors are very easy to get along with
- Guidance to grow in our jobs
cons: Not much, other than maybe the fact that most of us have to take time off during breaks and get no pay for a few weeks.

job_title: Student Assistant II in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great people to work for and with.  I work directly for Dr. Julie Albertson and she's a great supervisor.  It's a very independent, self organized job.
cons: A lot of training on politically correct topics and minimal opportunities in the field I am pursuing.  Many time pressing issues while taking classes.

job_title: Administrative Assistant (Work-study) in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: The University of Colorado, Colorado Springs Campus is full of great people. The Faculty and Staff are friendly, knowledgeable and seem very happy to be working at the University.
cons: Work study pay is minimal, but that is to be expected. Other employees get average or better pay.

job_title: Edit Team Specialist in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Wonderful, caring staff that is very accommodating to real-life situations. 
Trust students to do work that prepares them for post-graduate work.
cons: Nothing negative to report about UCCS finaid.

job_title: Technology in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: You and your family can continue your education with free classes. So many offices that you can always switch jobs and find new opportunities. Exciting, energetic place that has a fun mission.
cons: Parking and paying for parking for employees is steep.

job_title: UCCS IT in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: The best reason to work here is the environment. Good job for those without much experience in the work place.
cons: Some of the challenges is that you may need to learn many computer related problems and solutions that commonly happen.

job_title: Director in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Beautiful setting of Pike's Peak, wonderful students and expanding facilities.
cons: Slow to embrace/promote innovation and use of best practices. Many folks who would rather keep things as is and overworked employees.

job_title: Machine Shop Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: My supervisors were incredibly helpful, supportive, and always provided a safe, fun working environment. The vast amount of knowledge they have is second to none.
cons: I couldn't work there after graduating.

job_title: Student Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Flexible hours/days in working with student employees or employees going for higher degrees.
cons: Some offices have drama and even encourage the drama instead of capping the problem. Also some offices are like high school in having its groups/clicks.

job_title: Student Tutor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: This school is very flexible with its student body staff and provides many work opportunities.
cons: The pay is lower than a Starbucks job - but it builds up your resume and provides valuable interaction with the faculty.

job_title: Program Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: The benefits are very good, some job flexibility and autonomy.
cons: Can be very difficult to be chosen for an interview and hired.  Political environment.  Some positions have very limited opportunity for advancement.

job_title: Cashier/Barista in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Shift meals, customer service, and great coworkers
cons: Your bosses won't know what to do with you, and finding covers for your shifts will be a pain.

job_title: Student Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Study time, positive mentors, planning around schedule, understanding of schedule conflicts
cons: If campus is closed, work is closed. Low opportunity for wage increase.

job_title: IT Student Worker in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Very conscientious of not interfering with student schedules.  Working on campus makes the "campus experience" that much more fun.
cons: Can not work more than 25 hours a week.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Ability to work as a grad student
Depending on who you're specifically working for, they may pay generously
cons: Most of the time, people are being overworked for not enough pay

job_title: Graduate Assistant Athletic Performance Specialist in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Fun people to work with in an environment that encourages balance of life.
Athletes were fun to work with.
cons: Was only a one year position.

job_title: Teacher Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Short mandatory hours, grading hours were quite flexible
cons: There were no set job duties.

job_title: Teacher Assistant in Huntington, NY
pros: As long as the work got done you made your own hours in grading assignments.
cons: Cap on how many hours you can work a week.

job_title: Degree Audit Specialist in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Small department , 1 SUPER coworker
cons: Egotistical, sarcastic supervisor, 1 coworker who does as they please

job_title: Culinary Supervisor in University of Colorado, CO

Flexible.

No benefits.

job_title: Research Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Easy access to Professors and fast reply from them.
cons: Not many professor to handle current students.

job_title: Setup Crew in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
- People want to help work around your schedule
- Great people to work with
-Hours are flexible
cons: - Hours are unpredictable sometimes

job_title: Prep Cook in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: good insurance, 401k, holidays off
cons: Upper management are not in-tune to the everyday operation. Like to make dramatic changes with out giving direction.

job_title: Student Coordinator in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Some of the best management/leadership I have experienced in my career.
cons: You cannot work more than 25 hours during the semester.

job_title: Event Assistant in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: They are interested individual development of employees.

job_title: Student Assistant Web Developer in Colorado Springs, CO
pros:
Worked with class schedule
Friendly staff
The work was interesting
cons: Was hard to work at school and go to the same school

job_title: in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Great place to work. Every days a new day with new challenges
cons: Hours can vary, but still management.

job_title: Teacher Assistant, Laboratory Assistant and Grader in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Really good environment and fair compensation
cons: The number of workable hours is limited and not regular

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Challenging and rewarding work. Will help you develop writing and statistic skills
cons: Very time consuming and adds to your workload.

job_title: Faculty in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Good benefits, hard working students.
cons: Male dominated, outdated culture that is bad for men and women alike.

job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: I enjoyed being able to teach an unconventional class for a summer.
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Usher, Cashier, Box Office Associate in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: I loved the team dynamic, and the support from everyone in the department.
cons: The salary was less than desirable.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Great with working around your class schedule
cons: Pay was really low for the work and the area

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Maywood, CA
pros: Dynamic environment, diversity of cultures
cons: research depends on a fund that supports financial needs.

job_title: General Staff in Brookfield, WI
pros: Very friendly co-workers and supervisors.
cons: Normally there is nothing exiting going on.

job_title: Instructor in Colorado Springs, CO
pros: Flexible, Consistent, Supportive, Adaptable, Fair
cons: Slow moving to change, academic bureaucracy
